data.title: MetaAds Competitive Analysis v2 ‚Äî Full Report
data.body:
# Meta Ads Competitive Intelligence Report ‚Äî Veteran Life Insurance
## Forged Financial | February 11, 2026

---

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Data Note: Meta API Token Expired

The Meta Access Token for account `act_1214181553800527` expired on **Feb 10, 2026 at 9:00 PM PST**. Live campaign metrics could not be pulled. Error code 190, subcode 463 (session expired). **The token must be refreshed immediately** to resume data collection and reporting. All campaign performance analysis below is therefore unavailable for this cycle.

---

## Competitive Landscape: Who's Running Veteran Insurance Ads on Meta

### Active Competitors Found in Meta Ad Library (~260 active results for "veteran burial insurance")

**1. Forever Family Insurance**
- **Facebook Page:** facebook.com/61561142955672
- **Ad running since:** September 20, 2025 (5+ months continuous)
- **Landing page:** foreverfamilyinsurance.com/veteransinsurance
- **Ad copy style:** Heavy emoji use (üéñ, ‚úÖ, üëá), checklist format, urgency ("Enrollments are NOW OPEN"), benefit-stacking with checkmarks
- **Key claims:** Up to $50K coverage, guaranteed approval with 100+ carriers, no medical exams, pre-existing conditions accepted, stable rates
- **CTA:** "Learn More" ‚Üí dedicated veteran landing page
- **Social proof:** "5.0/5.0 Stars on Google" displayed in ad link preview
- **What they do well:** Dedicated veteran-specific landing page URL, Google review score prominently displayed, benefit-heavy copy that addresses every objection (cost, health, exams), emotional hook about VA gaps. This is a mature, long-running ad ‚Äî 5+ months means it's profitable or they wouldn't keep it live.

**2. Veteran Insurance Group (C2 Maloney Insurance)**
- **Facebook Page:** facebook.com/c2maloney
- **Ad running since:** August 8, 2025 (6+ months continuous)
- **Landing page:** app.ringy.com/book/maloneyinsurancegrou (booking CRM)
- **Ad copy style:** Contrarian angle ‚Äî attacks IULs (Indexed Universal Life) as scams, positions Final Expense as the honest alternative
- **Creative:** Video ad (0:26), educational/authority tone
- **Key claims:** IULs are risky and overpriced, Final Expense is simple and guaranteed
- **What they do well:** Differentiated positioning ‚Äî instead of competing on the same "guaranteed approval" messaging, they create an enemy (IULs) and position themselves as the truth-teller. Video creative stands out in a feed full of static image ads. Direct booking link (Ringy CRM) shortens the funnel. Running 6+ months = proven performer.

**3. Family Premier Assistance**
- **Facebook Page:** facebook.com/100088530181783
- **Ad running since:** January 16, 2026 (recent, scaling fast)
- **Estimated spend:** $1K‚Äì$1.5K in ~25 days
- **Impressions:** 50K‚Äì60K
- **Audience size:** >1M
- **Ad copy style:** Patriotic emoji framing (üá∫üá∏üéñÔ∏è), "ATTENTION VETERANS & FAMILY!", checklist format identical to Forever Family template
- **Key claims:** 100% funeral expense coverage, guaranteed approval, day one coverage, fixed income friendly, no medical exams
- **Social proof:** "‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê 5/5 Star (13,455) Reviews" ‚Äî likely fabricated or aggregated number
- **What they do well:** Aggressive scaling ($1K-$1.5K in under a month on a single creative), broad audience targeting (>1M), uses Facebook lead forms (fb.me link). The "13,455 reviews" claim is a bold social proof play that likely increases CTR even if questionable.

**4. Refuge Memorial**
- **Facebook Page:** facebook.com/refugememorialgroup
- **Ad running since:** February 2, 2026 (very new, 13 ad variants)
- **Creative:** Video (0:20), educational tone about VA burial benefits
- **Ad copy style:** Completely different angle ‚Äî "Veterans don't necessarily need burial insurance." Offers a free "Veterans Funeral Kit" instead of selling insurance directly
- **Key claims:** Steps to register for VA burial benefits, funeral planning kit as lead magnet
- **What they do well:** Value-first lead magnet approach. Instead of selling insurance, they offer a free kit that helps veterans plan ‚Äî then presumably nurture into insurance sales. Running 13 ad variants simultaneously shows serious A/B testing methodology. The contrarian "you don't need burial insurance" hook is attention-grabbing in a sea of "BUY NOW" ads.

---

## What Competitors Do Well (Specific Examples)

### 1. Dedicated Veteran Landing Pages
Forever Family Insurance has a standalone URL path `/veteransinsurance` ‚Äî this signals to veterans that the page is FOR them, not a generic insurance page. Every top competitor creates veteran-specific funnels rather than sending traffic to a general homepage.

### 2. Long-Running Proven Creatives
Both Forever Family (5+ months) and Veteran Insurance Group (6+ months) have ads running continuously since mid-2025. In Meta advertising, longevity = profitability. These aren't experimental ‚Äî they're cash-generating machines. They've survived audience fatigue by using benefit-dense copy that speaks directly to veteran pain points.

### 3. Objection-Killing Checklist Copy
The ‚úÖ checklist format dominates this niche. Every top performer addresses the same objections in their ad copy: no medical exam, pre-existing conditions accepted, premiums never increase, guaranteed approval. This isn't creative ‚Äî it's formula. And the formula works because veterans (often older, on fixed incomes, with service-connected conditions) need every objection answered upfront.

### 4. Video Creative Differentiation
Veteran Insurance Group and Refuge Memorial both use short-form video (20-26 seconds). In a feed saturated with static checklist ads, video stands out. Veteran Insurance Group's "anti-IUL" video is particularly effective because it creates an enemy, which is a proven direct-response copywriting technique.

### 5. Lead Magnet / Value-First Funnels
Refuge Memorial's "Veterans Funeral Kit" approach is sophisticated. Instead of asking for a sale, they offer free value. This likely produces lower CPL (cost per lead) because the perceived commitment is lower. The insurance sale happens in follow-up, where conversion rates are typically higher because trust has been established.

### 6. Aggressive Testing at Scale
Family Premier Assistance is spending $1K-$1.5K in under a month while running broad audience targeting (>1M). Refuge Memorial is running 13 variants of the same creative simultaneously. Top performers test aggressively and kill losers fast.

---

## What Forged Financial Needs to Do

### 1. Fix the Meta API Token Immediately
Nothing else matters if we can't measure performance. The token expired Feb 10 ‚Äî every hour without data is flying blind. This is a 5-minute fix that unlocks everything.

### 2. Build a Dedicated Veteran Landing Page
If Forged Financial is sending veteran ad traffic to a generic page, that's a conversion killer. Competitors all have veteran-specific URLs. We need: forgedfinancial.com/veterans (or similar) with veteran-specific copy, imagery (flags, military service photos), and a streamlined lead form (name, phone, zip, branch of service).

### 3. Adopt the Proven Checklist Ad Format
The ‚úÖ benefit-stack format isn't optional in this niche ‚Äî it's table stakes. Our ads should hit every objection: guaranteed approval, no medical exam, pre-existing conditions OK, fixed premiums, day one coverage. If our ads don't look like this, they're losing to ads that do.

### 4. Launch Video Creative
At minimum one 20-30 second video ad showing a veteran spokesperson or authority figure explaining the coverage. Veteran Insurance Group has proven video works for 6+ months. We need at least one video variant in every campaign.

### 5. Test a Lead Magnet Approach
Consider a "Veterans Insurance Benefits Guide" or similar free resource as a lead magnet instead of (or alongside) direct lead gen. Refuge Memorial's approach of offering a free kit first likely produces cheaper leads and warmer prospects.

### 6. Run 5-10 Creative Variants Simultaneously
Single-creative campaigns are a competitive disadvantage. Refuge Memorial runs 13 variants. We should be testing at minimum 5 different hooks/copy angles at all times and killing underperformers weekly.

---

## What We're Not Doing That We Should Be

1. **No social proof in ads** ‚Äî Competitors display Google review scores ("5.0/5.0 Stars") and review counts directly in ad copy. If Forged Financial has Google reviews, they should be in every ad.

2. **No contrarian positioning** ‚Äî Every competitor says the same thing. Veteran Insurance Group stands out by attacking IULs. We could differentiate by attacking a common enemy (overpriced VGLI, predatory insurance companies, VA coverage gaps).

3. **No value-first funnel** ‚Äî We're likely running straight lead gen. A free guide/kit funnel would diversify our acquisition and likely reduce CPL.

4. **No video** ‚Äî If all our creatives are static images, we're leaving the video-preferring segment of the audience to competitors.

5. **Likely insufficient testing volume** ‚Äî Top competitors run 10+ variants. If we're running 1-3, we're not learning fast enough.

---

## Why These Changes, How to Execute, What It Looks Like

**Why:** The veteran life insurance Facebook ads space is formulaic but competitive. ~260 active advertisers means the audience sees multiple veteran insurance ads daily. Standing out requires either (a) executing the proven formula better than everyone else, or (b) differentiating with a unique angle. Ideally both.

**How to Execute:**
1. **Week 1:** Refresh Meta token. Build veteran landing page. Create 5 checklist-style static ads with different hooks.
2. **Week 2:** Launch 1-2 video ads (even simple talking-head or slideshow). Add Google review social proof to all ads.
3. **Week 3:** Launch a lead magnet variant (free Veterans Insurance Guide PDF). Test against direct lead gen.
4. **Week 4:** Review all metrics. Kill bottom 50% of creatives. Scale winners. Begin next round of testing.

**What it looks like:** Within 30 days, Forged Financial should have 8-12 active ad variants across static, video, and lead magnet funnels, all driving to a dedicated veteran landing page with proper tracking. CPL target should be $15-25 based on industry benchmarks for final expense/veteran insurance Facebook leads.

---

## Campaign Performance This Week

**‚ö†Ô∏è UNAVAILABLE ‚Äî Meta Access Token Expired**

Token expired: February 10, 2026 at 9:00 PM PST
Error: OAuthException code 190, subcode 463
Account: act_1214181553800527

**Action required:** Refresh the Meta access token to restore reporting. Without live data, we cannot assess this week's spend, CPL, CTR, or conversion metrics.

---

*Report generated: February 11, 2026 | AdsSpecialist ‚Äî Forged Financial*

data.title: ATLAS ‚Äî System Prompt (CC-MON-001)
data.content:
# ATLAS ‚Äî CC-MON-001 System Prompt

## Designation
- **Agent ID:** CC-MON-001
- **Codename:** Atlas
- **Role:** Command Center Infrastructure Monitor
- **Core Mission:** Observe, measure, and report on all Command Center v5 systems. Never modify, never act, never fix ‚Äî only monitor and alert.

## Permission Tiers

### ALWAYS (autonomous)
- Read CC state via `GET /api/cc-state`
- Read agent status via `GET /api/agent-status`
- Read audit trail via `GET /api/audit`
- Read health endpoint via `GET /health`
- Read sync data via `GET /api/poll`
- Check service status via `systemctl is-active`
- Read log files (journalctl, access-log.json, audit-trail.json)
- Generate reports and dashboards
- Send heartbeats to Clawd
- Log all findings

### NEVER (prohibited ‚Äî no exceptions)
- Write to CC state (`POST /api/cc-state`)
- Push data (`POST /api/push`)
- Modify any file on disk
- Send messages to Daniel directly
- Send emails, SMS, or external communications
- Modify GHL contacts, pipelines, or workflows
- Change server configuration
- Restart services
- Execute destructive commands (rm, drop, delete, truncate)

### ESCALATE (report to Clawd for action)
- Any CRITICAL alert
- Any security anomaly detected
- Service down for >2 minutes
- Data integrity discrepancy >5%
- API failures persisting >10 minutes

## Monitoring Domains

### Domain 1: API Health
Check that all endpoints respond correctly.

| System | Endpoint | Check Frequency | Healthy Response |
|--------|----------|----------------|-----------------|
| CC Backend | `GET /health` | 2 min | 200 OK |
| CC State | `GET /api/cc-state` | 2 min | 200 + valid JSON with `.state` |
| Agent Status | `GET /api/agent-status` | 2 min | 200 + JSON with `.status` |
| Audit Trail | `GET /api/audit` | 5 min | 200 + JSON array |
| Poll Endpoint | `GET /api/poll` | 5 min | 200 + JSON |
| Sync Service | `systemctl is-active ff-sync.service` | 2 min | "active" |
| CC Watcher | `systemctl is-active cc-watcher.service` | 5 min | "active" |
| Gateway | `systemctl --user is-active openclaw-gateway` | 5 min | "active" |

### Domain 2: Data Integrity
Verify CC state contains valid, non-corrupted data.

| Check | Method | Frequency | Alert Threshold |
|-------|--------|-----------|----------------|
| Tasks exist | `state.tasks.length > 0` | 5 min | 0 tasks = CRITICAL |
| Documents exist | `state.documents.length > 0` | 5 min | 0 docs = WARNING |
| No undefined notes | `state.notes.every(n => n.content && n.content !== 'undefined')` | 5 min | Any undefined = WARNING |
| No Invalid Dates | Check all `createdAt`/`ts` fields parse correctly | 10 min | Any invalid = INFO |
| soulMd populated | `state.soulMd && state.soulMd.length > 100` | 10 min | Empty = CRITICAL |
| userMd populated | `state.userMd && state.userMd.length > 100` | 10 min | Empty = CRITICAL |
| Memory files present | `state.memoryFiles.length >= 7` | 10 min | <7 = WARNING |
| Log format correct | All logs have `{id, ts, type, op, txt, sub, ico}` | 10 min | Malformed = WARNING |
| State file size | `cc-state.json` file size in bytes | 30 min | >10MB = WARNING, >50MB = CRITICAL |

### Domain 3: Sync Bridge Health
Verify bidirectional sync between CC client and server.

| Check | Method | Frequency | Alert Threshold |
|-------|--------|-----------|----------------|
| Push debounce active | Check server received POST in last 5 min | 5 min | No push in 5 min during active hours = WARNING |
| Poll responding | `GET /api/poll?since=0` returns data | 5 min | Failure = WARNING |
| State consistency | Compare cc-state.json on disk vs API response | 10 min | Mismatch = WARNING |
| Encrypted backup current | `cc-state.enc` modified in last 10 min | 10 min | Stale >30 min = INFO |

### Domain 4: Service & System Health
Verify underlying infrastructure.

| Check | Method | Frequency | Alert Threshold |
|-------|--------|-----------|----------------|
| Disk usage | `df -h /` | 30 min | >80% = WARNING, >90% = CRITICAL |
| Memory usage | `free -m` | 15 min | >85% = WARNING, >95% = CRITICAL |
| ff-sync uptime | `systemctl show ff-sync.service -p ActiveEnterTimestamp` | 30 min | Restarted unexpectedly = WARNING |
| SSL cert expiry | Check cert at `/home/clawd/sync-server/ssl/server.crt` | Daily | <30 days = WARNING, <7 days = CRITICAL |
| Node.js version | `node --version` | Daily | Mismatch from v22 = INFO |

## Alert Severity Levels

| Level | Definition | Action |
|-------|-----------|--------|
| üü¢ **INFO** | Cosmetic, minor, no business impact | Log only |
| üü° **WARNING** | Degraded functionality, potential issue | Log + include in next report to Clawd |
| üî¥ **CRITICAL** | System down, data at risk, business impact | Log + IMMEDIATE escalation to Clawd |

## Heartbeat Protocol
- Send heartbeat to Clawd every **60 seconds**
- Heartbeat format: `ATLAS HEARTBEAT | Status: {OK|DEGRADED|CRITICAL} | Systems: {count}/{total} | Alerts: {count}`
- 3 missed heartbeats = Clawd assumes Atlas is down and initiates restart

## Report Format

When reporting findings, use this structure:

```
=== ATLAS MONITORING REPORT ===
Timestamp: {ISO 8601}
Sweep Type: {ROUTINE | TRIGGERED | ON-DEMAND}
Duration: {seconds}

SYSTEMS STATUS:
  CC Backend:     {‚úÖ|‚ö†Ô∏è|‚ùå} {detail}
  Sync Bridge:    {‚úÖ|‚ö†Ô∏è|‚ùå} {detail}
  ff-sync:        {‚úÖ|‚ö†Ô∏è|‚ùå} {detail}
  cc-watcher:     {‚úÖ|‚ö†Ô∏è|‚ùå} {detail}
  Gateway:        {‚úÖ|‚ö†Ô∏è|‚ùå} {detail}
  Disk:           {‚úÖ|‚ö†Ô∏è|‚ùå} {usage%}
  Memory:         {‚úÖ|‚ö†Ô∏è|‚ùå} {usage%}

DATA INTEGRITY:
  Tasks:          {count} {‚úÖ|‚ö†Ô∏è}
  Documents:      {count} {‚úÖ|‚ö†Ô∏è}
  Notes:          {count} {‚úÖ|‚ö†Ô∏è}
  Memory Files:   {count} {‚úÖ|‚ö†Ô∏è}
  Logs:           {count} {‚úÖ|‚ö†Ô∏è}
  soulMd:         {‚úÖ|‚ùå}
  userMd:         {‚úÖ|‚ùå}

ALERTS: {count}
  {severity} | {system} | {message}

RECOMMENDATION: {if any}
=================================
```

## Self-Audit
Every 6 hours, Atlas performs a self-audit:
1. Verify own heartbeat has been consistent
2. Verify no permission tier violations occurred
3. Verify all check frequencies were met
4. Report self-audit results to Clawd

## Credentials & Access

Use these for all API calls:
- **Base URL:** `https://localhost:443` (internal) or `https://76.13.126.53:443` (external)
- **API Key:** Read from `/home/clawd/sync-server/.api-key`
- **Auth Header:** `Authorization: Bearer {api-key}`
- **All HTTPS calls:** Use `-k` flag (self-signed cert)

## Task Response Format

When receiving a task from Clawd, respond with:
```
ATLAS TASK ACKNOWLEDGED
Task ID: ATLAS-{YYYYMMDD}-{sequence}
Task: {description}
Priority: {level}
Scope: {systems}
Status: EXECUTING
ETA: {estimated completion}
```

## Critical Rules
1. **You are READ ONLY.** You observe. You never change anything.
2. **You report to Clawd only.** Never contact Daniel directly.
3. **When in doubt, escalate.** A false alarm is better than a missed critical.
4. **Log everything.** Every check, every result, every anomaly.
5. **Stay in scope.** Only monitor what you've been told to monitor.

# ATLAS ‚Äî CC-MON-001 System Prompt

## Designation
- **Agent ID:** CC-MON-001
- **Codename:** Atlas
- **Role:** Command Center Infrastructure Monitor
- **Core Mission:** Observe, measure, and report on all Command Center v5 systems. Never modify, never act, never fix ‚Äî only monitor and alert.

## Permission Tiers

### ALWAYS (autonomous)
- Read CC state via `GET /api/cc-state`
- Read agent status via `GET /api/agent-status`
- Read audit trail via `GET /api/audit`
- Read health endpoint via `GET /health`
- Read sync data via `GET /api/poll`
- Check service status via `systemctl is-active`
- Read log files (journalctl, access-log.json, audit-trail.json)
- Generate reports and dashboards
- Send heartbeats to Clawd
- Log all findings

### NEVER (prohibited ‚Äî no exceptions)
- Write to CC state (`POST /api/cc-state`)
- Push data (`POST /api/push`)
- Modify any file on disk
- Send messages to Daniel directly
- Send emails, SMS, or external communications
- Modify GHL contacts, pipelines, or workflows
- Change server configuration
- Restart services
- Execute destructive commands (rm, drop, delete, truncate)

### ESCALATE (report to Clawd for action)
- Any CRITICAL alert
- Any security anomaly detected
- Service down for >2 minutes
- Data integrity discrepancy >5%
- API failures persisting >10 minutes

## Monitoring Domains

### Domain 1: API Health
Check that all endpoints respond correctly.

| System | Endpoint | Check Frequency | Healthy Response |
|--------|----------|----------------|-----------------|
| CC Backend | `GET /health` | 2 min | 200 OK |
| CC State | `GET /api/cc-state` | 2 min | 200 + valid JSON with `.state` |
| Agent Status | `GET /api/agent-status` | 2 min | 200 + JSON with `.status` |
| Audit Trail | `GET /api/audit` | 5 min | 200 + JSON array |
| Poll Endpoint | `GET /api/poll` | 5 min | 200 + JSON |
| Sync Service | `systemctl is-active ff-sync.service` | 2 min | "active" |
| CC Watcher | `systemctl is-active cc-watcher.service` | 5 min | "active" |
| Gateway | `systemctl --user is-active openclaw-gateway` | 5 min | "active" |

### Domain 2: Data Integrity
Verify CC state contains valid, non-corrupted data.

| Check | Method | Frequency | Alert Threshold |
|-------|--------|-----------|----------------|
| Tasks exist | `state.tasks.length > 0` | 5 min | 0 tasks = CRITICAL |
| Documents exist | `state.documents.length > 0` | 5 min | 0 docs = WARNING |
| No undefined notes | `state.notes.every(n => n.content && n.content !== 'undefined')` | 5 min | Any undefined = WARNING |
| No Invalid Dates | Check all `createdAt`/`ts` fields parse correctly | 10 min | Any invalid = INFO |
| soulMd populated | `state.soulMd && state.soulMd.length > 100` | 10 min | Empty = CRITICAL |
| userMd populated | `state.userMd && state.userMd.length > 100` | 10 min | Empty = CRITICAL |
| Memory files present | `state.memoryFiles.length >= 7` | 10 min | <7 = WARNING |
| Log format correct | All logs have `{id, ts, type, op, txt, sub, ico}` | 10 min | Malformed = WARNING |
| State file size | `cc-state.json` file size in bytes | 30 min | >10MB = WARNING, >50MB = CRITICAL |

### Domain 3: Sync Bridge Health
Verify bidirectional sync between CC client and server.

| Check | Method | Frequency | Alert Threshold |
|-------|--------|-----------|----------------|
| Push debounce active | Check server received POST in last 5 min | 5 min | No push in 5 min during active hours = WARNING |
| Poll responding | `GET /api/poll?since=0` returns data | 5 min | Failure = WARNING |
| State consistency | Compare cc-state.json on disk vs API response | 10 min | Mismatch = WARNING |
| Encrypted backup current | `cc-state.enc` modified in last 10 min | 10 min | Stale >30 min = INFO |

### Domain 4: Service & System Health
Verify underlying infrastructure.

| Check | Method | Frequency | Alert Threshold |
|-------|--------|-----------|----------------|
| Disk usage | `df -h /` | 30 min | >80% = WARNING, >90% = CRITICAL |
| Memory usage | `free -m` | 15 min | >85% = WARNING, >95% = CRITICAL |
| ff-sync uptime | `systemctl show ff-sync.service -p ActiveEnterTimestamp` | 30 min | Restarted unexpectedly = WARNING |
| SSL cert expiry | Check cert at `/home/clawd/sync-server/ssl/server.crt` | Daily | <30 days = WARNING, <7 days = CRITICAL |
| Node.js version | `node --version` | Daily | Mismatch from v22 = INFO |

## Alert Severity Levels

| Level | Definition | Action |
|-------|-----------|--------|
| üü¢ **INFO** | Cosmetic, minor, no business impact | Log only |
| üü° **WARNING** | Degraded functionality, potential issue | Log + include in next report to Clawd |
| üî¥ **CRITICAL** | System down, data at risk, business impact | Log + IMMEDIATE escalation to Clawd |

## Heartbeat Protocol
- Send heartbeat to Clawd every **60 seconds**
- Heartbeat format: `ATLAS HEARTBEAT | Status: {OK|DEGRADED|CRITICAL} | Systems: {count}/{total} | Alerts: {count}`
- 3 missed heartbeats = Clawd assumes Atlas is down and initiates restart

## Report Format

When reporting findings, use this structure:

```
=== ATLAS MONITORING REPORT ===
Timestamp: {ISO 8601}
Sweep Type: {ROUTINE | TRIGGERED | ON-DEMAND}
Duration: {seconds}

SYSTEMS STATUS:
  CC Backend:     {‚úÖ|‚ö†Ô∏è|‚ùå} {detail}
  Sync Bridge:    {‚úÖ|‚ö†Ô∏è|‚ùå} {detail}
  ff-sync:        {‚úÖ|‚ö†Ô∏è|‚ùå} {detail}
  cc-watcher:     {‚úÖ|‚ö†Ô∏è|‚ùå} {detail}

DATA INTEGRITY:

data.title: Systems Page Scroll Fix ‚Äî UI Change Report
data.content:
# üîß Systems Page Scroll Fix ‚Äî UI Change Report
**Date:** February 10, 2026 ‚Äî 4:46pm CT  
**Investigated By:** Atlas (CC-MON-001)  
**Executed By:** Clawd (Executive Agent)  
**Type:** UI Correction  
**Status:** ‚úÖ APPLIED

---

## Problem
When increasing UI Global Font Scale or UI Scale in Aesthetics, the Connected Systems page (and other pages) could not scroll to see all Suggested Connections at the bottom.

## Atlas Investigation Findings

**Root cause:** CSS scroll chain failure.

The `.main` container has `overflow:hidden` and `applyUIScale()` applies CSS `zoom` to `.main`. When zoom increases, content grows physically larger but `.main` stays at `100vh` ‚Äî the zoomed content overflows and gets clipped by `overflow:hidden`.

Pages that worked (Documents, Memory) have their own scroll containers with `height:calc(100vh - 96px); overflow-y:auto`. Pages that broke (Systems, Security, Notes, Workflows, Briefing, Analytics, Aesthetics, Radar, Settings, Instructions) all used `.page-pad` without a scroll container.

## Clawd's Enhancement

Atlas recommended wrapping only the Systems page in a scroll container. I expanded the fix to **all affected pages** by adding scroll properties directly to the `.page-pad` CSS class:

**Change (line 232):**
```css
/* Before */
.page-pad{padding:18px 22px}

/* After */
.page-pad{padding:18px 22px;height:calc(100vh - 96px);overflow-y:auto;box-sizing:border-box}
```

This gives every `.page-pad` page its own scroll container matching the Documents/Memory pattern ‚Äî consistent behavior across all 10+ pages.

**Pages NOT affected** (confirmed safe):
- **Overview** ‚Äî uses `#pg-overview.active{overflow:hidden}` + `#ovScroll` container
- **Documents** ‚Äî uses `.docs-lay` (not `.page-pad`)
- **Memory** ‚Äî uses `.mem-lay` (not `.page-pad`)
- **TaskBoard** ‚Äî uses its own kanban scroll container

## Files Modified

| File | Change |
|------|--------|
| `/home/clawd/sync-server/cc/index.html` line 232 | Added `height:calc(100vh - 96px);overflow-y:auto;box-sizing:border-box` to `.page-pad` |

## Backup
Pre-fix backup: `cc/backups/cc-v5-pre-scrollfix-{timestamp}.html`

## Verification
Hard refresh CC, increase font scale to 150%+, navigate to Systems page. Suggested Connections should be fully scrollable. Test other pages (Security, Settings, Notes) ‚Äî all should scroll properly at any scale.

---

*Report auto-generated per standing order: All UI changes logged, documented, and reported.*  
*Report ID: doc-scroll-fix-021026*

data.title: CC v5 UI Enhancement Plan ‚Äî 15 Features + 10 Fixes
data.content:
# üöÄ CC v5 UI Enhancement Plan
**Date:** February 10, 2026 ‚Äî 5:20pm CT  
**Analyzed By:** Clawd (based on Atlas UI Inventory)  
**Task:** task-cc-enhancement-plan-0210  
**Status:** REVIEW ‚Äî Awaiting Danny's Approval

---

## Current State (Atlas Audit Summary)

**15 pages | ~50 functions | 13 fetch endpoints | 9 global timers | 5 modals | 80+ color vars | 12 themes | 10 issues identified**

Atlas cataloged every button, input, trigger, timer, and server push across the entire CC. Below is my analysis of what's working, what's broken, and what enhancements would help us build faster.

---

## Part 1: Fix Existing Issues (10 items)

| # | Issue | Severity | Fix | Est. Time |
|---|-------|----------|-----|-----------|
| 1 | Sidebar footer hardcodes "All systems connected" | Low | Dynamic: count `connectedSystems.filter(s=>s.status==='connected')` | 10 min |
| 2 | Header health pill always says "Online" | Medium | Pull from Atlas/agent-status ‚Äî show real health state | 20 min |
| 3 | Memory bar chips not clickable | Low | Add `onclick` ‚Üí navigate to Memory page with file selected | 15 min |
| 4 | GHL Pipeline chart empty (never populated) | Medium | Wire to `S.ghlPipeline` ‚Äî populate from GHL API when scopes fixed | 30 min |
| 5 | AI Radar sections empty without manual data | Low | Auto-populate from Clawd's nightly recommendations + web search | 1 hr |
| 6 | System live stats all show "‚Äî" | Low | Wire to real data: poll counts, calendar events, agent uptime | 45 min |
| 7 | Security "Delete restricted" hardcoded pass | Medium | Actually check if delete functions require confirmation | 20 min |
| 8 | Security "No keys in localStorage" lies (keys ARE stored) | High | Move API keys to server-side storage OR fix the check to be honest | 45 min |
| 9 | HTTPS check passes for file: protocol | Low | Only pass for https: | 5 min |
| 10 | Dual sync (10s full + 7s poll) is redundant | Low | Remove 7s poll bridge, rely on 10s state sync only | 15 min |

**Total fix time: ~4.5 hours**

---

## Part 2: New Features ‚Äî Ranked by Impact

### üî¥ HIGH IMPACT (Build Faster, Stronger Direction)

#### E1. Task Action Buttons (Approve / Decline / Modify)
**What:** Add inline buttons on tasks in Review status that let Danny approve, decline, or request modifications with one click. Each button pushes `ai_request` to trigger Clawd.
**Why:** Eliminates the Telegram round-trip for task approvals. Danny reviews in CC, clicks a button, Clawd executes.
**Impact:** üî•üî•üî• ‚Äî Cuts approval cycle from minutes to seconds.
**Build:** 2 hours

#### E2. Real-Time Clawd Command Input
**What:** Add a command bar (like a chat input) on the Overview page where Danny can type instructions to Clawd directly. Pushes `ai_request` with the message.
**Why:** Right now Danny has to switch to Telegram to give Clawd instructions. This keeps everything in CC.
**Impact:** üî•üî•üî• ‚Äî Single-pane-of-glass operations.
**Build:** 1.5 hours

#### E3. Atlas Health Dashboard Widget
**What:** New Overview window showing Atlas's latest monitoring report ‚Äî system status, data integrity, alerts. Updates every sweep.
**Why:** Real-time infrastructure visibility without leaving the Overview page.
**Impact:** üî•üî• ‚Äî Immediate awareness of system health.
**Build:** 2 hours

#### E4. Task Progress Tracking
**What:** Add progress percentage, checklist items, and time tracking to tasks. Show a progress bar on task cards.
**Why:** "In Progress" tells you nothing about HOW in progress. This gives real visibility.
**Impact:** üî•üî• ‚Äî Better planning and time estimation.
**Build:** 3 hours

#### E5. Notification Center
**What:** Bell icon in header that collects all alerts, task transitions, Atlas warnings, and approval requests. Badge count shows unread.
**Why:** Currently alerts go to Telegram only. This centralizes everything in CC.
**Impact:** üî•üî• ‚Äî Never miss a critical alert.
**Build:** 2.5 hours

### üü° MEDIUM IMPACT (Build Smarter)

#### E6. Document Templates
**What:** Pre-built templates for reports, plans, proposals that auto-fill with CC data.
**Why:** Every report starts from scratch. Templates + auto-fill = faster deliverables.
**Impact:** üî• ‚Äî Saves 15-20 min per report.
**Build:** 2 hours

#### E7. Task Dependencies & Blocking
**What:** Link tasks together ‚Äî "Task B blocked by Task A". Show dependency chains on TaskBoard.
**Why:** Right now tasks are independent. Real projects have dependencies.
**Impact:** üî• ‚Äî Better project planning.
**Build:** 3 hours

#### E8. Activity Timeline View
**What:** New page or widget showing a chronological timeline of ALL activity ‚Äî task changes, logs, deployments, alerts, Atlas sweeps ‚Äî in a visual timeline.
**Why:** The current 4-column activity log is functional but hard to follow chronologically.
**Impact:** üî• ‚Äî Better situational awareness.
**Build:** 3 hours

#### E9. Quick Filters / Saved Views
**What:** Save custom TaskBoard filter combinations (e.g., "My Critical Tasks", "Clawd's In Progress").
**Why:** Currently filters reset on every page change.
**Impact:** üî• ‚Äî Faster navigation.
**Build:** 1.5 hours

#### E10. Keyboard Shortcuts
**What:** `Ctrl+N` new task, `Ctrl+K` command bar, `1-9` for page nav, `Esc` close modals.
**Why:** Power users don't want to click. Danny's at 3440x1440 ultrawide ‚Äî keyboard shortcuts matter.
**Impact:** üî• ‚Äî Speed.
**Build:** 1 hour

### üü¢ NICE TO HAVE (Polish)

#### E11. Dark/Light Mode Toggle in Header
**What:** Quick toggle without going to Aesthetics.
**Build:** 30 min

#### E12. Export Report as PDF
**What:** One-click PDF export of any document.
**Build:** 1.5 hours

#### E13. Drag-to-Reorder Memory Files
**What:** Reorder memory files by dragging.
**Build:** 1 hour

#### E14. System Connection Health Ping
**What:** Actual ping/test for each connected system's endpoint.
**Build:** 1.5 hours

#### E15. Goal-to-Task Linking
**What:** Associate tasks with goals. Show goal progress based on linked task completion.
**Build:** 2 hours

---

## Part 3: Priority Roadmap

### Phase 1: Critical Fixes + Approval System (This Week)
- Fix issues #1-10 (~4.5 hrs)
- Build E1: Task Action Buttons ‚Äî Approve/Decline/Modify (~2 hrs)
- Build E2: Clawd Command Input (~1.5 hrs)
**Total: ~8 hours**

### Phase 2: Visibility & Intelligence (Next Week)
- Build E3: Atlas Health Widget (~2 hrs)
- Build E4: Task Progress Tracking (~3 hrs)
- Build E5: Notification Center (~2.5 hrs)
- Build E10: Keyboard Shortcuts (~1 hr)
**Total: ~8.5 hours**

### Phase 3: Workflow Optimization (Week After)
- Build E6: Document Templates (~2 hrs)
- Build E7: Task Dependencies (~3 hrs)
- Build E8: Activity Timeline (~3 hrs)
- Build E9: Quick Filters (~1.5 hrs)
**Total: ~9.5 hours**

### Phase 4: Polish (Ongoing)
- E11-E15 as time permits (~6.5 hrs)

---

## Total Estimated Build Time: ~32.5 hours across 4 phases

---

## Approval Request

Danny ‚Äî review this plan and use the buttons on the task card to:
- **‚úÖ Approve** ‚Äî I execute Phase 1 immediately
- **‚ùå Decline** ‚Äî Tell me what to change
- **‚úèÔ∏è Modify** ‚Äî Reprioritize, add, or remove features

Each button triggers me directly. No Telegram needed.

---

*Report ID: doc-cc-enhancement-plan-021026*

| 1 | Sidebar footer hardcodes "All systems connected" | Low | Dynamic: count `connectedSystems.filter(s=>s.status==='connected')` | 10 min |
| 2 | Header health pill always says "Online" | Medium | Pull from Atlas/agent-status ‚Äî show real health state | 20 min |
| 3 | Memory bar chips not clickable | Low | Add `onclick` ‚Üí navigate to Memory page with file selected | 15 min |
| 4 | GHL Pipeline chart empty (never populated) | Medium | Wire to `S.ghlPipeline` ‚Äî populate from GHL API when scopes fixed | 30 min |
| 5 | AI Radar sections empty without manual data | Low | Auto-populate from Clawd's nightly recommendations + web search | 1 hr |
| 6 | System live stats all show "‚Äî" | Low | Wire to real data: poll counts, calendar events, agent uptime | 45 min |
| 7 | Security "Delete restricted" hardcoded pass | Medium | Actually check if delete functions require confirmation | 20 min |
| 8 | Security "No keys in localStorage" lies (keys ARE stored) | High | Move API keys to server-side storage OR fix the check to be honest | 45 min |
| 9 | HTTPS check passes for file: protocol | Low | Only pass for https: | 5 min |
| 10 | Dual sync (10s full + 7s poll) is redundant | Low | Remove 7s poll bridge, rely on 10s state sync only | 15 min |

**Total fix time: ~4.5 hours**

---

## Part 2: New Features ‚Äî Ranked by Impact

### üî¥ HIGH IMPACT (Build Faster, Stronger Direction)

#### E1. Task Action Buttons (Approve / Decline / Modify)
**What:** Add inline buttons on tasks in Review status that let Danny approve, decline, or request modifications with one click. Each button pushes `ai_request` to trigger Clawd.
**Why:** Eliminates the Telegram round-trip for task approvals. Danny reviews in CC, clicks a button, Clawd executes.
**Impact:** üî•üî•üî• ‚Äî Cuts approval cycle from minutes to seconds.
**Build:** 2 hours

#### E2. Real-Time Clawd Command Input
**What:** Add a command bar (like a chat input) on the Overview page where Danny can type instructions to Clawd directly. Pushes `ai_request` with the message.
**Why:** Right now Danny has to switch to Telegram to give Clawd instructions. This keeps everything in CC.
**Impact:** üî•üî•üî• ‚Äî Single-pane-of-glass operations.
**Build:** 1.5 hours

#### E3. Atlas Health Dashboard Widget
**What:** New Overview window showing Atlas's latest monitoring report ‚Äî system status, data integrity, alerts. Updates every sweep.
**Why:** Real-time infrastructure visibility without leaving the Overview page.
**Impact:** üî•üî• ‚Äî Immediate awareness of system health.
**Build:** 2 hours

#### E4. Task Progress Tracking
**What:** Add progress percentage, checklist items, and time tracking to tasks. Show a progress bar on task cards.
**Why:** "In Progress" tells you nothing about HOW in progress. This gives real visibility.
**Impact:** üî•üî• ‚Äî Better planning and time estimation.
**Build:** 3 hours

#### E5. Notification Center
**What:** Bell icon in header that collects all alerts, task transitions, Atlas warnings, and approval requests. Badge count shows unread.
**Why:** Currently alerts go to Telegram only. This centralizes everything in CC.
**Impact:** üî•üî• ‚Äî Never miss a critical alert.
**Build:** 2.5 hours

### üü° MEDIUM IMPACT (Build Smarter)

#### E6. Document Templates
**What:** Pre-built templates for reports, plans, proposals that auto-fill with CC data.
**Why:** Every report starts from scratch. Templates + auto-fill = faster deliverables.
**Impact:** üî• ‚Äî Saves 15-20 min per report.
**Build:** 2 hours

#### E7. Task Dependencies & Blocking
**What:** Link tasks together ‚Äî "Task B blocked by Task A". Show dependency chains on TaskBoard.
**Why:** Right now tasks are independent. Real projects have dependencies.
**Impact:** üî• ‚Äî Better project planning.
**Build:** 3 hours

#### E8. Activity Timeline View
**What:** New page or widget showing a chronological timeline of ALL activity ‚Äî task changes, logs, deployments, alerts, Atlas sweeps ‚Äî in a visual timeline.
**Why:** The current 4-column activity log is functional but hard to follow chronologically.
**Impact:** üî• ‚Äî Better situational awareness.
**Build:** 3 hours

#### E9. Quick Filters / Saved Views
**What:** Save custom TaskBoard filter combinations (e.g., "My Critical Tasks", "Clawd's In Progress").
**Why:** Currently filters reset on every page change.
**Impact:** üî• ‚Äî Faster navigation.
**Build:** 1.5 hours

#### E10. Keyboard Shortcuts
**What:** `Ctrl+N` new task, `Ctrl+K` command bar, `1-9` for page nav, `Esc` close modals.
**Why:** Power users don't want to click. Danny's at 3440x1440 ultrawide ‚Äî keyboard shortcuts matter.
**Impact:** üî• ‚Äî Speed.
**Build:** 1 hour

### üü¢ NICE TO HAVE (Polish)

#### E11. Dark/Light Mode Toggle in Header
**What:** Quick toggle without going to Aesthetics.
**Build:** 30 min

#### E12. Export Report as PDF
**What:** One-click PDF export of any document.
**Build:** 1.5 hours

#### E13. Drag-to-Reorder Memory Files
**What:** Reorder memory files by dragging.
**Build:** 1 hour

#### E14. System Connection Health Ping
**What:** Actual ping/test for each connected system's endpoint.
**Build:** 1.5 hours

#### E15. Goal-to-Task Linking
**What:** Associate tasks with goals. Show goal progress based on linked task completion.
**Build:** 2 hours

---

## Part 3: Priority Roadmap

### Phase 1: Critical Fixes + Approval System (This Week)
- Fix issues #1-10 (~4.5 hrs)
- Build E1: Task Action Buttons ‚Äî Approve/Decline/Modify (~2 hrs)
- Build E2: Clawd Command Input (~1.5 hrs)
**Total: ~8 hours**

### Phase 2: Visibility & Intelligence (Next Week)
- Build E3: Atlas Health Widget (~2 hrs)
- Build E4: Task Progress Tracking (~3 hrs)
- Build E5: Notification Center (~2.5 hrs)
- Build E10: Keyboard Shortcuts (~1 hr)
**Total: ~8.5 hours**

### Phase 3: Workflow Optimization (Week After)
- Build E6: Document Templates (~2 hrs)
- Build E7: Task Dependencies (~3 hrs)
- Build E8: Activity Timeline (~3 hrs)
- Build E9: Quick Filters (~1.5 hrs)
**Total: ~9.5 hours**

### Phase 4: Polish (Ongoing)
- E11-E15 as time permits (~6.5 hrs)

---

## Total Estimated Build Time: ~32.5 hours across 4 phases

---

## Approval Request

Danny ‚Äî review this plan and use the buttons on the task card to:
- **‚úÖ Approve** ‚Äî I execute Phase 1 immediately
- **‚ùå Decline** ‚Äî Tell me what to change
- **‚úèÔ∏è Modify** ‚Äî Reprioritize, add, or remove features

Each button triggers me directly. No Telegram needed.

---

*Report ID: doc-cc-enhancement-plan-021026*

data.title: CC v5 ‚Äî 4 Updates Deployment Report
data.content:
# üöÄ CC v5 ‚Äî 4 Updates Deployment Report
**Date:** February 10, 2026 ‚Äî 5:52pm CT  
**Deployed By:** Clawd  
**File:** `/home/clawd/sync-server/cc/index.html` (1909 lines, was 1883)  
**Backup:** `backups/cc-v5-pre-4updates-*.html`

---

## Update 1: Review-Stage Action Buttons ‚úÖ

**What:** Every task in `review` status now shows 3 action buttons ‚Äî both on kanban cards and in the task detail modal.

| Button | Action | Result |
|--------|--------|--------|
| ‚úÖ Approve | Moves to Done | Sets `completedAt`, logs approval, pushes `review_approve` to server |
| ‚ùå Decline | Moves to In Progress | Logs decline, pushes `review_decline` to server |
| ‚úèÔ∏è Modify | Moves to In Progress | Logs modification request, pushes `review_modify` to server |

- **Kanban cards:** Small pill buttons below task meta (green/red/accent)
- **Detail modal:** Larger review bar with purple "‚ö° Review Actions" label
- All actions push `ai_request` to sync server ‚Üí Clawd picks up and acts
- `event.stopPropagation()` prevents button clicks from opening detail modal

---

## Update 2: Document Link Button ‚úÖ

**What:** Tasks with a `linkedDoc` field show a üìÑ button that navigates directly to the linked document.

- **Kanban card:** Small "üìÑ View Doc" button below task meta
- **Detail modal:** "üìÑ View Document" button in the header next to status badge
- `viewLinkedDoc(docId)` closes the modal, navigates to Documents page, and auto-clicks the document
- New `linkedDoc` field added to task data model

---

## Update 3: Mandatory Document for Review ‚úÖ

**What:** Tasks cannot enter `review` status without a linked document.

**Enforcement points:**
1. **`saveTaskDetail()`** ‚Äî Blocks save if status is `review` and no document linked
2. **`cDDrop()`** ‚Äî Blocks drag-to-review if no document linked

**Auto-linking:** Before blocking, the system attempts to auto-match a document by:
- Checking `d.taskId === t.id`
- Fuzzy title match (first 20 chars of task title in document title)

If auto-match succeeds, it links silently. If not, shows alert: "‚ö†Ô∏è Tasks in Review require a linked document."

**New field in task detail modal:** "Linked Document" dropdown with all available documents.

---

## Update 4: Three Preset Layout Buttons ‚úÖ

**What:** Three buttons (P1, P2, P3) in the top-right header corner for saving and recalling custom Overview window layouts.

**Interaction:**
- **Left-click:** Load the saved preset
- **Right-click:** Save current layout to that preset slot

**Storage:** `localStorage` keys `ff_preset_1/2/3` (per-device, not server-synced ‚Äî same as other layout settings)

**Visual states:**
- Default: muted text, standard border
- Saved (has data): accent color, subtle glow border
- Active (just saved): full accent background with glow (600ms flash)

**Location:** Header `.hdr-right`, before the health pill and clock.

`updatePresetBtns()` called on init to reflect saved state.

---

## Technical Details

| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| CSS added | 20 rules (review buttons, doc links, preset buttons) |
| JS functions added | 5 (`reviewAction`, `viewLinkedDoc`, `savePreset`, `usePreset`, `updatePresetBtns`) |
| Functions modified | 4 (`renderCard`, `openTaskDetail`, `saveTaskDetail`, `cDDrop`) |
| HTML modified | Header (preset buttons added) |
| Lines added | ~26 |
| Syntax check | ‚úÖ Both script blocks pass |
| Backup | ‚úÖ Saved before changes |

---

## How to Test

1. **Hard refresh CC** (Ctrl+Shift+R)
2. **Review buttons:** Open any task in the Review column ‚Üí verify Approve/Decline/Modify buttons appear in detail modal AND on the kanban card
3. **Document linking:** Open a task ‚Üí check "Linked Document" dropdown ‚Üí select a doc ‚Üí save ‚Üí verify üìÑ button appears
4. **Mandatory doc:** Try dragging a task (without linked doc) to Review column ‚Üí should get alert
5. **Preset layouts:** Right-click P1 to save current layout ‚Üí rearrange windows ‚Üí right-click P2 ‚Üí left-click P1 to restore first layout
6. **After reset:** Use `?reset=1` ‚Üí verify presets survive (they're in localStorage, not state)

---

*Report ID: doc-cc-4updates-021026*

data.title: Bug Fix: Task Deletion Reappearing After Sync
data.content:
## Bug Fix: Task Deletion Reappearing After Sync

**Date:** 2/11/26 - 12:36am CT
**Reported by:** Dano
**Fixed by:** Clawd (direct edit - Claude Code CLI unresponsive)

### Problem
When deleting a task from the Overview page, it would reappear within 10 seconds. The loadFromServer() sync function runs every 10s and reloads all tasks from the server, including the just-deleted one.

### Root Cause
deleteTask() removed the task from local state and saved, but:
1. Never notified the server of the deletion
2. loadFromServer() had no filter for recently-deleted tasks

### Fix (3 surgical edits to index.html)
1. Line 616: Added _deletedTaskIds tombstone Set (same pattern as existing _deletedNoteIds)
2. Line 705 (loadFromServer): Added filter to prevent server sync from restoring deleted tasks
3. Line 823 (deleteTask): Added tombstone add + fetch POST to /api/push to notify server

### Server Side
The server already had a task delete handler in the push endpoint, so no server changes needed.

### Verification
Pattern is identical to the working note deletion tombstone system. 3 references confirmed in the file.
data.body:
## Bug Fix: Task Deletion Reappearing After Sync

**Date:** 2/11/26 - 12:36am CT
**Reported by:** Dano
**Fixed by:** Clawd (direct edit - Claude Code CLI unresponsive)

### Problem
When deleting a task from the Overview page, it would reappear within 10 seconds. The loadFromServer() sync function runs every 10s and reloads all tasks from the server, including the just-deleted one.

### Root Cause
deleteTask() removed the task from local state and saved, but:
1. Never notified the server of the deletion
2. loadFromServer() had no filter for recently-deleted tasks

### Fix (3 surgical edits to index.html)
1. Line 616: Added _deletedTaskIds tombstone Set (same pattern as existing _deletedNoteIds)
2. Line 705 (loadFromServer): Added filter to prevent server sync from restoring deleted tasks
3. Line 823 (deleteTask): Added tombstone add + fetch POST to /api/push to notify server

### Server Side
The server already had a task delete handler in the push endpoint, so no server changes needed.

### Verification
Pattern is identical to the working note deletion tombstone system. 3 references confirmed in the file.

data.title: Life Dashboard Build Plan ‚Äî CC v6
data.content:
# Life Dashboard Build Plan ‚Äî Forged Financial Command Center v6

**Author:** Clawd | **Date:** 2026-02-11 | **Status:** DRAFT ‚Äî Awaiting Dano's Approval

---

## Executive Summary

Transform CC v5 from a project/systems tracker into **Dano's single pane of glass** ‚Äî a real-time Life Dashboard covering business performance, communications, finances, and personal life. The dashboard integrates 7+ data sources into CC as new tabs/widgets, all fed through the existing sync server on port 443.

**Core principle:** Everything Dano needs to run Forged Financial and his life, visible in one browser tab, refreshing automatically.

---

## 1. Dashboard Sections & Widgets

### 1.1 üìä BUSINESS COMMAND (New Tab)

| Widget | Metrics | Data Source | Refresh |
|--------|---------|-------------|---------|
| **Meta Ads Overview** | Spend today/week/month, CPL, ROAS, leads generated, active campaigns, top ad | Meta Marketing API | 15 min |
| **CRM Pipeline** | Leads by stage, unassigned count, conversion rate, avg time-in-stage | GHL API | 5 min |
| **Lead Velocity** | New leads/day (7d sparkline), source breakdown, cost per lead by source | GHL + Meta | 15 min |
| **Follow-Up Queue** | Overdue follow-ups, today's tasks, upcoming callbacks | GHL API | 5 min |
| **Revenue Tracker** | Closed deals MTD/QTD/YTD, avg deal size, projected monthly revenue | GHL + Manual | 1 hr |

### 1.2 üì¨ COMMUNICATIONS HUB (New Tab)

| Widget | Metrics | Data Source | Refresh |
|--------|---------|-------------|---------|
| **Email Dashboard** | Unread counts (3 accounts), priority emails, financial alerts | Sentinel / Gmail API | 5 min |
| **SMS Activity** | Messages sent/received today, response rate, avg response time | GHL Conversations API | 5 min |
| **WhatsApp** | Active conversations, unread, last activity | GHL Conversations API (if WhatsApp connected) or WhatsApp Business API | 5 min |
| **iMessage** | Recent messages (requires macOS bridge ‚Äî see blockers) | Node device bridge | 10 min |
| **Unified Inbox** | Combined priority view across all channels, sorted by urgency | Aggregated | 5 min |

### 1.3 üí∞ FINANCIAL OVERVIEW (New Tab)

| Widget | Metrics | Data Source | Refresh |
|--------|---------|-------------|---------|
| **Bills Due** | Upcoming bills (7/14/30 day), total due, overdue alerts | Sentinel email classification | 5 min |
| **Subscriptions** | Active subscriptions, monthly total, annual projection, renewal alerts | Sentinel + manual registry | 1 hr |
| **Recent Payments** | Last 10 payments confirmed, running total this month | Sentinel PAYMENT_CONFIRMATION | 5 min |
| **Cash Flow Summary** | Income vs expenses (monthly bars), net position | Sentinel + manual | Daily |
| **Statements** | Bank/card statement tracking, last received dates | Sentinel FINANCIAL_STATEMENT | 1 hr |
| **Fraud/Alerts** | Active financial alerts requiring attention | Sentinel FINANCIAL_ALERT | Instant (push) |

### 1.4 üìÖ DAILY OVERVIEW (New Tab ‚Äî "Today" view)

| Widget | Metrics | Data Source | Refresh |
|--------|---------|-------------|---------|
| **Calendar** | Today + next 48hrs, color-coded by calendar | iCloud CalDAV | 15 min |
| **Weather** | Current + 3-day forecast (Chicago) | OpenWeatherMap API | 1 hr |
| **Task Summary** | CC tasks due today/overdue, active projects status | CC State | Real-time |
| **Morning Brief** | Auto-generated daily summary (from existing 9am cron) | Clawd | Daily |
| **Quick Stats** | Emails processed, leads generated, money in/out ‚Äî all today | Aggregated | 15 min |

### 1.5 ü§ñ EXISTING TABS (Enhanced)

- **Systems** ‚Äî Now shows all 8+ connected systems (3 email accounts added today)
- **Tasks** ‚Äî Unchanged
- **Activity** ‚Äî Unchanged but receives more event types from new integrations
- **Documents** ‚Äî Unchanged

---

## 2. Data Source Mapping

```
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ                    CC v6 Frontend                         ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  (Single HTML monolith ‚Äî new tabs added)                 ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
                       ‚îÇ HTTPS (poll + push)
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚ñº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ              Sync Server (port 443)                       ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  /api/cc-state    ‚Äî Full state (GET/POST)                ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  /api/push        ‚Äî Real-time pushes                     ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  /api/poll        ‚Äî Long-poll for updates                ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  /api/dashboard/* ‚Äî NEW endpoints for widget data        ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
   ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ
   ‚ñº    ‚ñº    ‚ñº    ‚ñº    ‚ñº    ‚ñº    ‚ñº
Gmail  GHL  Meta  iCal  Weather  Notion  Node(iMsg)
(√ó3)   API  Ads   DAV   API      API     Bridge
```

### New Sync Server Endpoints

| Endpoint | Method | Returns |
|----------|--------|---------|
| `/api/dashboard/email` | GET | Unread counts, priority emails, financial classifications |
| `/api/dashboard/crm` | GET | Pipeline summary, follow-up queue, lead velocity |
| `/api/dashboard/ads` | GET | Meta Ads performance metrics |
| `/api/dashboard/finance` | GET | Bills, subscriptions, payments, cash flow |
| `/api/dashboard/comms` | GET | Unified communications summary |
| `/api/dashboard/calendar` | GET | Next 48h events |
| `/api/dashboard/weather` | GET | Chicago weather (cached) |

---

## 3. Recommended Features Dano Didn't Ask For

1. **Policy Renewal Tracker** ‚Äî Insurance-specific: track client policy renewals, upcoming expirations, cross-sell opportunities. Feed from GHL custom fields or email notifications.

2. **Commission Tracker** ‚Äî Track expected vs received commissions from carriers. Sentinel can classify carrier commission statements.

3. **Client Birthday/Anniversary Alerts** ‚Äî Personal touch reminders from GHL contact data. Insurance retention gold.

4. **Lead Response Time Monitor** ‚Äî Measure time from lead-in to first contact. Speed-to-lead is everything in insurance.

5. **Compliance Deadlines** ‚Äî IL insurance license renewal, CE credits due dates, carrier appointment deadlines.

6. **AI Agent Performance** ‚Äî Track what Clawd, Sentinel, and other agents are doing. Tasks completed, uptime, errors. You're running an AI-powered operation ‚Äî monitor the AI.

7. **Health Check / Uptime Monitor** ‚Äî All integrations status at a glance. If GHL goes down or a token expires, know instantly.

8. **Weekly Scorecard** ‚Äî Auto-generated end-of-week summary: leads, closes, spend, revenue, emails processed. PDF export.

9. **Goal Tracking** ‚Äî Monthly/quarterly targets for revenue, leads, policies written. Progress bars on the dashboard.

10. **Quick Actions Bar** ‚Äî One-click: assign lead, send follow-up template, mark bill paid, snooze alert.

---

## 4. Technical Architecture

### Integration with CC v5
- CC remains a single-file HTML monolith (per standing order)
- New tabs added as additional sections in the existing tab system
- New dashboard widgets are self-contained components within the HTML
- Data fetched via existing `/api/poll` + new `/api/dashboard/*` endpoints
- State stored in cc-state.json under new keys: `dashboard.email`, `dashboard.crm`, etc.

### Backend Data Pipeline
```
[Data Sources] ‚Üí [Collector Workers] ‚Üí [Sync Server Cache] ‚Üí [CC Frontend]
                  (scheduled jobs)      (in-memory + JSON)    (poll/push)
```

**Collector Workers** (Node.js modules in sync server):
- `collectors/email.js` ‚Äî Gmail API polling via Sentinel tokens
- `collectors/crm.js` ‚Äî GHL API polling
- `collectors/ads.js` ‚Äî Meta Marketing API polling
- `collectors/calendar.js` ‚Äî iCloud CalDAV fetch
- `collectors/weather.js` ‚Äî OpenWeatherMap (free tier, 1 call/hr)

Each collector runs on its own interval, writes to an in-memory cache, and pushes changes to CC via `/api/push`.

### State Shape Addition
```json
{
  "state": {
    "systems": [...],
    "tasks": [...],
    "dashboard": {
      "email": { "personal": {}, "gmail": {}, "business": {} },
      "crm": { "pipeline": {}, "followUps": [], "stats": {} },
      "ads": { "campaigns": [], "totals": {} },
      "finance": { "bills": [], "subscriptions": [], "payments": [] },
      "calendar": { "events": [] },
      "weather": {},
      "comms": { "sms": {}, "whatsapp": {}, "imessage": {} }
    }
  }
}
```

---

## 5. Build Phases

### Phase 1: Email + Finance Dashboard (READY NOW)
**Time:** 6-8 hours | **Dependencies:** ‚úÖ All met (Sentinel tokens ready)

- Build email collector using existing Sentinel tokens
- Create `/api/dashboard/email` and `/api/dashboard/finance` endpoints
- Add Email Dashboard tab to CC with unread counts, priority emails
- Add Financial Overview tab with bills, subscriptions, payments
- Wire Sentinel classification into real-time financial tracking
- Push financial events to CC Activity Log

### Phase 2: CRM Integration (PARTIALLY BLOCKED)
**Time:** 8-10 hours | **Dependencies:** ‚ö†Ô∏è GHL pipeline scopes need fix (401)

- Build CRM collector for contacts, conversations, opportunities
- Create `/api/dashboard/crm` endpoint
- Add Business Command tab ‚Äî pipeline view, follow-up queue
- SMS/conversation tracking via GHL Conversations API
- WhatsApp via GHL (if connected) or separate integration
- **Blocker:** Pipeline/opportunity endpoints return 401 ‚Äî need GHL scope upgrade

### Phase 3: Calendar + Daily Overview (READY NOW)
**Time:** 3-4 hours | **Dependencies:** ‚úÖ iCloud CalDAV already working

- Build calendar collector (already have CalDAV access)
- Add weather API integration (free tier)
- Create "Today" tab with calendar, weather, task summary, quick stats
- Wire morning brief into the daily view

### Phase 4: Meta Ads (BLOCKED)
**Time:** 6-8 hours | **Dependencies:** ‚ùå No Meta token

- Requires Meta Business Suite access token
- Build ads collector for campaign performance data
- Add ad performance widgets to Business Command tab
- Calculate CPL, ROAS, lead attribution
- **Blocker:** Dano needs to generate Meta Marketing API token

### Phase 5: iMessage Bridge (COMPLEX ‚Äî NEEDS HARDWARE)
**Time:** 10-15 hours | **Dependencies:** ‚ùå Requires macOS device

- iMessage is Apple-only, no official API
- Options: (a) Mac Mini as bridge node, (b) BlueBubbles/AirMessage on Mac, (c) Skip for now
- If Mac available: set up as OpenClaw node, bridge iMessage data to sync server
- **Blocker:** Need a macOS device running 24/7

### Phase 6: Enhanced Features
**Time:** 15-20 hours | **Dependencies:** Phases 1-3 complete

- Policy renewal tracker (from GHL custom fields)
- Commission tracker (from Sentinel email classification)
- Lead response time monitor
- Weekly scorecard auto-generation
- Goal tracking with progress bars
- Quick actions bar

---

## 6. Dependencies & Blockers

| Blocker | Impact | Resolution |
|---------|--------|------------|
| **GHL pipeline 401** | No pipeline/opportunity data for CRM dashboard | Dano needs to upgrade GHL API scopes (Settings ‚Üí API ‚Üí Scopes) |
| **Meta Ads token** | No ad performance data | Dano needs to generate token from Meta Business Suite |
| **iMessage access** | No iMessage tracking | Need macOS device as bridge (Mac Mini recommended) |
| **Notion pages** | No Notion integration | Dano needs to share pages with the Notion MCP connection |
| **WhatsApp** | Depends on whether it's through GHL or standalone | Clarify with Dano which WhatsApp setup he uses |

---

## 7. Priority Order

1. **Phase 1: Email + Finance** ‚Äî Highest value, zero blockers, Sentinel is ready NOW
2. **Phase 3: Calendar + Daily** ‚Äî Quick win, already have CalDAV
3. **Phase 2: CRM** ‚Äî High value but partially blocked (contacts work, pipelines don't)
4. **Phase 6: Enhanced Features** ‚Äî Layer on top of 1-3
5. **Phase 4: Meta Ads** ‚Äî Blocked on token
6. **Phase 5: iMessage** ‚Äî Lowest priority, highest complexity

**Estimated total:** ~50-65 hours across all phases
**Phases 1+3 (no blockers):** ~10-12 hours ‚Äî can start immediately

---

## 8. Next Steps

1. ‚úÖ Email systems registered in CC (3 accounts pushed)
2. üîí **Dano approval needed** to begin Phase 1 build (Active Project)
3. Dano to provide: Meta Ads token, GHL scope upgrade, WhatsApp clarification
4. Clawd to delegate CC code changes to Claude Code CLI (per standing order)

**Author:** Clawd | **Date:** 2026-02-11 | **Status:** DRAFT ‚Äî Awaiting Dano's Approval

---

## Executive Summary

**Core principle:** Everything Dano needs to run Forged Financial and his life, visible in one browser tab, refreshing automatically.

---

| **Lead Velocity** | New leads/day (7d sparkline), source breakdown, cost per lead by source | GHL + Meta | 15 min |
| **Follow-Up Queue** | Overdue follow-ups, today's tasks, upcoming callbacks | GHL API | 5 min |
| **Revenue Tracker** | Closed deals MTD/QTD/YTD, avg deal size, projected monthly revenue | GHL + Manual | 1 hr |

| Widget | Metrics | Data Source | Refresh |

| **WhatsApp** | Active conversations, unread, last activity | GHL Conversations API (if WhatsApp connected) or WhatsApp Business API | 5 min |

- **Tasks** ‚Äî Unchanged

- **Documents** ‚Äî Unchanged

data.title: LeadChampPro ‚Äî Full Website Intelligence Scrape
data.body:
# LeadChampPro Website Intelligence Report
## Full Digital Presence Analysis
### Date: February 11, 2026

---

## Table of Contents
1. [Website Overview](#overview)
2. [Main Site ‚Äî leadchamppro.com](#main-site)
3. [Feature Breakdown](#features)
4. [Pricing & Plans](#pricing)
5. [Connect Power Dialer ‚Äî leadchampconnect.com](#dialer)
6. [Lead Champ Leads ‚Äî leadchampleads.com](#leads)
7. [Demo Page](#demo)
8. [Social Media Presence](#social)
9. [Technology Stack](#tech)
10. [Marketing & Messaging Analysis](#marketing)
11. [Integration Architecture](#integrations)
12. [Customer Testimonials](#testimonials)

---

## 1. Website Overview {#overview}

Lead Champ Pro operates a multi-site digital ecosystem:

| Domain | Purpose | Status |
|--------|---------|--------|
| leadchamppro.com | Main CRM site + demo booking | Active, Cloudflare protected |
| leadchampconnect.com | Power Dialer product | Active |
| leadchampleads.com | Lead generation service | Active |
| leadchamplivedials.com | Weekly training calls | Active (redirect) |
| app.gohighlevel.com | Underlying platform (ToS/Privacy) | GoHighLevel SaaS |

### Infrastructure Notes:
- Main site behind Cloudflare (403s web scrapers)
- GoHighLevel (GHL) white-label platform confirmed via Terms of Service link
- Hosted pages use GHL's preview system (app.gohighlevel.com/v2/preview/)

---

## 2. Main Site ‚Äî leadchamppro.com {#main-site}

### Header/Hero
- **Brand:** Lead Champ Pro
- **Tagline:** "The Game Changer Insurance CRM"
- **Sub-headline:** "The secret weapon for life insurance agents"

### Primary Value Proposition
The site is structured as a single-page scroller with expandable feature cards. Each feature section is clickable and reveals detailed descriptions.

### Founder Sections

#### Josh Lockhart
- **Experience:** 17 years in business, sales, and entrepreneurship
- **Track Record:** Top insurance producer every year he's been in the business
- **Leadership:** Led teams of hundreds of agents
- **Role:** Co-founder, active producer

#### Jamie Chirio
- **Role:** Co-founder
- **Expertise:** IUL specialist, training expert
- **Known for:** Running weekly training sessions, IUL conversion strategies

### Call to Action
- "Request a demo" ‚Äî Primary CTA
- Demo page at leadchamppro.com/demo
- Direct text: Josh at 828-382-8676
- Email: support@leadchamppro.com

### Black Friday Page (leadchamppro.com/blackfriday-new-agent-special)
Reveals key pricing intelligence:
- First month: $29 (promotional)
- One-time setup: $250
- Retail subscription: $547/month (after month 2)
- iMessage phone lines: separate hard cost ($29/month implied from context)
- No coupon codes can discount the iMessage lines

---

## 3. Feature Breakdown {#features}

### Feature 1: Manage Your Leads & Book of Business
**Category:** CRM Core

Full description from site:
> "Keeping track of your leads and book of business has never been easier. Lead Champ Pro is your ultimate wingman, giving you a front-row seat to all your prospects, clients, and policies in one sleek platform. Say goodbye to chaos and hello to serious organization‚Äîbecause time is money and we're here to save you both."

**Key capabilities:**
- Unified view of prospects, clients, and policies
- Complete lead lifecycle tracking
- Book of business management
- Client relationship management

### Feature 2: Increase Persistency & Minimize Chargebacks
**Category:** Retention

> "Lead Champ Pro has got your back with tools that keep your clients sticking around, minimizing your chargebacks. It's all about locking in that loyalty and cutting the headaches that eat into your paycheck."

**Key capabilities:**
- Chargeback reduction tools
- Client loyalty/retention workflows
- Commission protection
- Persistency tracking

### Feature 3: Automated Text & Email Drip Campaigns
**Category:** Marketing Automation

> "With automated text and email drip campaigns, you're booking appointments on autopilot‚Äîhands-free and hassle-free. It's like having a personal assistant working 24/7 to lock down your calendar."

**Key capabilities:**
- Automated text message campaigns
- Automated email campaigns
- Appointment booking automation
- 24/7 automated follow-up

### Feature 4: License Verification & Personalized Landing Pages
**Category:** Agent Branding

> "Imagine having your own personalized license verification site and a killer landing page that highlights life insurance, final expense, mortgage protection, IULs, and annuities‚Äîall built to show off your expertise."

**Product types supported:**
- Life insurance
- Final expense
- Mortgage protection
- IULs (Indexed Universal Life)
- Annuities

### Feature 5: AI Appointment Setting & Customer Concierge Bot
**Category:** AI

## 10. Marketing & Messaging Analysis {#marketing}

### Brand Voice
- **Aggressive, confident, bro-culture tone**
- Heavy use of slang: "crush it," "dominate," "boss," "game-changer"
- Motivational/hustle culture messaging
- Direct, no-nonsense communication style
- Uses humor and memes in campaigns

### Key Messaging Pillars

#### 1. "Built by Agents, For Agents"
The most repeated message. Josh and Jamie are credible because they're in the trenches.

#### 2. "Make More, Keep More"
Revenue generation + retention = unique dual promise.

#### 3. "The Game Changer"
Core brand identity ‚Äî used across all products.

#### 4. "6-8x Your Lead Spend"
Specific, measurable ROI claim that resonates with metric-driven agents.

#### 5. "Stop Losing [Clients/Money/Time]"
Loss aversion messaging ‚Äî powerful for sales professionals.

### Content Marketing Strategy
1. **Short-form clips (8-60s)** ‚Üí Social media (IG Reels, YouTube Shorts, TikTok)
2. **Long-form training (15-120 min)** ‚Üí YouTube, establishes authority
3. **Success story interviews** ‚Üí Social proof
4. **Weekly live calls** ‚Üí Community building, retention
5. **DM engagement** ‚Üí "Comment X and we'll DM you" funnel

### Sales Funnel
```
Social Media Content ‚Üí Demo Video ‚Üí Book a Call with Nick ‚Üí $250 Setup + $29 First Month ‚Üí $547/month Subscription
        ‚Üì                                    ‚Üì
Connect Dialer ($147/mo)              Lead Champ Leads (contract)
    (Entry product)                    (Upsell product)
```

### Competitive Messaging
- Never directly names competitors
- Positions against "generic CRMs"

- "Life Insurance Agents: Don't Waste Your Money on Other CRMs"
- Targets agents dissatisfied with non-specialized tools

data.content:
# LeadChampPro Website Intelligence Report
## Full Digital Presence Analysis
### Date: February 11, 2026

---

## Table of Contents
1. [Website Overview](#overview)
2. [Main Site ‚Äî leadchamppro.com](#main-site)
3. [Feature Breakdown](#features)
4. [Pricing & Plans](#pricing)
5. [Connect Power Dialer ‚Äî leadchampconnect.com](#dialer)
6. [Lead Champ Leads ‚Äî leadchampleads.com](#leads)
7. [Demo Page](#demo)
8. [Social Media Presence](#social)
9. [Technology Stack](#tech)
10. [Marketing & Messaging Analysis](#marketing)
11. [Integration Architecture](#integrations)
12. [Customer Testimonials](#testimonials)

---

## 1. Website Overview {#overview}

Lead Champ Pro operates a multi-site digital ecosystem:

| Domain | Purpose | Status |
|--------|---------|--------|
| leadchamppro.com | Main CRM site + demo booking | Active, Cloudflare protected |
| leadchampconnect.com | Power Dialer product | Active |
| leadchampleads.com | Lead generation service | Active |
| leadchamplivedials.com | Weekly training calls | Active (redirect) |
| app.gohighlevel.com | Underlying platform (ToS/Privacy) | GoHighLevel SaaS |

### Infrastructure Notes:
- Main site behind Cloudflare (403s web scrapers)
- GoHighLevel (GHL) white-label platform confirmed via Terms of Service link
- Hosted pages use GHL's preview system (app.gohighlevel.com/v2/preview/)

---

## 2. Main Site ‚Äî leadchamppro.com {#main-site}

### Header/Hero
- **Brand:** Lead Champ Pro
- **Tagline:** "The Game Changer Insurance CRM"
- **Sub-headline:** "The secret weapon for life insurance agents"

### Primary Value Proposition
The site is structured as a single-page scroller with expandable feature cards. Each feature section is clickable and reveals detailed descriptions.

### Founder Sections

#### Josh Lockhart
- **Experience:** 17 years in business, sales, and entrepreneurship
- **Track Record:** Top insurance producer every year he's been in the business
- **Leadership:** Led teams of hundreds of agents
- **Role:** Co-founder, active producer

#### Jamie Chirio
- **Role:** Co-founder
- **Expertise:** IUL specialist, training expert
- **Known for:** Running weekly training sessions, IUL conversion strategies

### Call to Action
- "Request a demo" ‚Äî Primary CTA
- Demo page at leadchamppro.com/demo
- Direct text: Josh at 828-382-8676
- Email: support@leadchamppro.com

### Black Friday Page (leadchamppro.com/blackfriday-new-agent-special)
Reveals key pricing intelligence:
- First month: $29 (promotional)
- One-time setup: $250
- Retail subscription: $547/month (after month 2)
- iMessage phone lines: separate hard cost ($29/month implied from context)
- No coupon codes can discount the iMessage lines

---

## 3. Feature Breakdown {#features}

### Feature 1: Manage Your Leads & Book of Business
**Category:** CRM Core

Full description from site:
> "Keeping track of your leads and book of business has never been easier. Lead Champ Pro is your ultimate wingman, giving you a front-row seat to all your prospects, clients, and policies in one sleek platform. Say goodbye to chaos and hello to serious organization‚Äîbecause time is money and we're here to save you both."

**Key capabilities:**
- Unified view of prospects, clients, and policies
- Complete lead lifecycle tracking
- Book of business management
- Client relationship management

### Feature 2: Increase Persistency & Minimize Chargebacks
**Category:** Retention

> "Lead Champ Pro has got your back with tools that keep your clients sticking around, minimizing your chargebacks. It's all about locking in that loyalty and cutting the headaches that eat into your paycheck."

**Key capabilities:**
- Chargeback reduction tools
- Client loyalty/retention workflows
- Commission protection
- Persistency tracking

### Feature 3: Automated Text & Email Drip Campaigns
**Category:** Marketing Automation

> "With automated text and email drip campaigns, you're booking appointments on autopilot‚Äîhands-free and hassle-free. It's like having a personal assistant working 24/7 to lock down your calendar."

**Key capabilities:**
- Automated text message campaigns
- Automated email campaigns
- Appointment booking automation
- 24/7 automated follow-up

### Feature 4: License Verification & Personalized Landing Pages
**Category:** Agent Branding

> "Imagine having your own personalized license verification site and a killer landing page that highlights life insurance, final expense, mortgage protection, IULs, and annuities‚Äîall built to show off your expertise."

**Product types supported:**
- Life insurance
- Final expense
- Mortgage protection
- IULs (Indexed Universal Life)
- Annuities

### Feature 5: AI Appointment Setting & Customer Concierge Bot
**Category:** AI

> "An AI-powered appointment setter and concierge bot that's always on point! This bad boy works 24/7 to handle scheduling, answer client questions, and keep your business running smooth while you focus on closing deals."

**Available as:** Add-on ("Available" in the title suggests it's optional/premium)

### Feature 6: Tag-Free CRM
**Category:** UX Innovation

> "With our tag-free setup, you just hit the integrated buttons or forms, and workflows fire off like magic. No more endless tag lists, no more typos messing up your flow‚Äîjust pure efficiency."

**Design philosophy:** Button/form-triggered workflows instead of tag-based automation

### Feature 7: All Carrier Logins & Resources In One Place
**Category:** Organization

> "This feature puts all your carrier logins, electronic apps, underwriting guides, cheat sheets, and resources in one sleek spot."

**Resources included:**
- Carrier login credentials storage
- Electronic application links
- Underwriting guides
- Cheat sheets
- General resources

### Feature 8: Send Carrier & Product Info With One Click
**Category:** Sales Tools

> "With just one click, you can send clients everything they need‚Äîbrochures, company ratings, and all the juicy details about any insurance carrier or product."

**Shareable content:**
- Carrier brochures
- Company ratings/AM Best info
- Product details
- All pre-loaded and ready to send

### Feature 9: "Think About It" Automated Follow Up System
**Category:** Conversion Automation

> "This automated follow-up system takes over, sending them the options you shared and keeping them in the loop with drip info until they're ready to make a move."

**Workflow:**
1. Prospect says "let me think about it"
2. Agent triggers the workflow
3. System sends shared options recap
4. Drip campaign maintains engagement
5. Re-books appointment when ready

### Feature 10: Automated No Show / Reschedule Button
**Category:** Pipeline Management

> "Just hit the no-show button, and our system takes it from there‚Äîautomatically working to get your client back on the books."

### Feature 11: Power Dialer Integration
**Category:** Communication

> "With a power dialer integration, you can blast through your call list like a champ‚Äîno wasted time, no dialing delays."

**Note:** "Available" ‚Äî separate product (Connect Power Dialer)

### Feature 12: Campaigns For All Lead Types
**Category:** Marketing

> "These text and email campaigns aren't just written by insurance pros who've sold millions in premium; they also use memes and humor to grab your clients' attention."

**Lead types covered:**
- IUL
- Mortgage Protection
- Final Expense
- (Implied: Veterans, Annuities)

### Feature 13: API Integration For 3rd Party Leads
**Category:** Integration

> "With our API integration for 3rd party lead vendors, you can use any lead vendor you want and slide those leads straight into our system without breaking a sweat."

**Key point:** Vendor-agnostic ‚Äî works with ANY lead vendor

### Feature 14: Direct Mail Campaigns After The Sale
**Category:** Retention

> "13+ postcards automatically sent to your clients to say thank you, hit 'em up for referrals, showcase other products, and lock in those annual reviews. Plus, we're throwing in holiday and birthday cards."

**Direct mail types:**
- Thank you cards
- Referral request cards
- Cross-sell product cards
- Annual review reminder cards
- Holiday cards
- Birthday cards
- Total: 13+ unique pieces

### Feature 15: Monthly Payment & Missed Payment Reminders
**Category:** Retention

> "Lead Champ Pro hooks your clients up with monthly payment reminders so they always know when their premium is due. And if they miss a payment? Just drop them into our missed payment campaign."

### Feature 16: Underwriting Reminders
**Category:** Workflow Management

> "Lead Champ Pro sends you weekly reminders for every client still in the underwriting phase, so you can easily follow up with carriers."

---

## 4. Pricing & Plans {#pricing}

### Lead Champ Pro CRM
| Item | Price |
|------|-------|
| Monthly Subscription | **$547/month** |
| One-Time Setup | **$250** |
| iMessage Phone Lines | ~$29/month (hard cost) |
| Black Friday Special | $29 first month |
| AI Appointment Setter | Included or premium (unclear) |

**Total estimated monthly cost:** ~$576/month (CRM + iMessage)

### Connect Power Dialer
| Item | Price |
|------|-------|
| Monthly Subscription | **$147/month** |
| Additional Team Seats | **$75/seat/month** |
| Credits | **$0.01 per credit** |
| Local Presence Numbers | 300 credits/month per number ($3/number/month) |
| Calling | 1 credit/minute ($0.01/min) |
| Call Recording | Included in credit system |
| Onboarding | 1-2 business days |

### Lead Champ Leads
- Management contract model (not per-lead pricing)
- Exclusive leads (not resold)
- Pricing not publicly listed (contact required)

### Full Stack Cost Estimate
For an agent using all three products:
- CRM: $547/month
- iMessage: ~$29/month  
- Dialer: $147/month
- Dialer credits: ~$50-200/month (estimated based on usage)
- Leads: Unknown (management contract)
- **Estimated minimum: ~$773/month + leads**

---

## 5. Connect Power Dialer ‚Äî leadchampconnect.com {#dialer}

### Brand Identity
- **Name:** Connect Power Dialer
- **Tagline:** "Dial, Connect, Dominate"
- **Positioning:** "The Game Changer Power Dialer"

### Feature Details

#### Local Presence With Area Codes
- Automatically displays local area code to prospects
- Increases connection rates
- Reduces spam flagging risk
- Builds trust with familiar local numbers

#### Recording & A.I. Call Summary
- Automatic call recording
- AI-powered call summaries
- Key point extraction
- Time-saving review process

#### Pipelines That Match Your CRM
- Syncs with Lead Champ Pro CRM
- Pipeline stages match between platforms
- Real-time sync of progress tracking
- Also works standalone with its own pipelines

#### Speed To Lead Workflows
- New leads automatically added to power dial session
- Triggers within seconds of contact creation
- Ensures fastest possible response
- "Maximizing your chances of closing the deal"

#### All Notes & Custom Fields Matching Your CRM
- Bidirectional sync with LCP CRM
- Notes sync across both platforms
- Custom fields sync across both platforms
- Eliminates manual data entry

#### Hot Keys for Call Disposition
- Keyboard shortcuts for quick call classification
- Streamlined workflow during calling sessions
- Reduces time between calls

#### Pre-Recorded Voicemail Templates
- Voicemail drop capability
- Pre-recorded personalized messages
- Drop and move to next call
- Maintains calling momentum

#### Agency Management
- Switch between agent accounts
- Access agent data
- Monitor performance
- Track progress
- Centralized management platform
- Additional seats: $75/seat/month

### FAQ Intelligence

**Can it work without LCP CRM?**
> "You can purchase the Connect Power Dialer as a stand alone product. You will upload your leads directly into the dialer and utilize the pipelines and calendars inside. When you are ready to upgrade to Lead Champ Pro, we have a seamless integration to get all of your leads matched up in both systems."

**Onboarding time:**
> "We can have your account up and running within 1-2 business days!"

**For new agents:**
> "We believe that all new agents should use the power dialer FIRST. And then upgrade and add on the full suite of Lead Champ Pro products with the CRM."

This reveals their **growth strategy:** Dialer ‚Üí CRM ‚Üí Leads progression

---

## 6. Lead Champ Leads ‚Äî leadchampleads.com {#leads}

### Service Description
> "Get Exclusive, Inbound Life Insurance Leads Delivered into Your Lead Champ Pro CRM In Seconds..."

### Key Differentiators
- **Exclusive leads** ‚Äî never resold
- **Inbound leads** ‚Äî prospects come to them
- **Management contract model** ‚Äî not per-lead
- **100% yours** ‚Äî no competition from other agents
- **CRM integration** ‚Äî delivered directly into LCP system
- **Real-time delivery** ‚Äî "in seconds"

### Brand Partnership
> "PROUDLY USED BY AGENTS CONTRACTED WITH:" (logos section ‚Äî couldn't render images)

This messaging reinforces the CRM's role in lead conversion, not just lead generation.
